column4: hello would like some help. Just did export path to java but now get error that path doesnt exist what can i do to solve the problem
get the error /bin/java  no such file or directory so how can i change it?
What command did you run to export that path exactly?
Of course, but what did you put after the export?
Ah, that should probably be export JAVA_HOME=/usr/lib/jvm/java-6-sun
ok and how can i change that? do i just run the export comand again?
Yes. Why do you need to set JAVA_HOME btw?
because i need to instal cruisecontroll
Ok. Most apps will find in the standard location instead of requiring JAVA_HOME to be set, but some probably don't.
when you change JAVA_HOME do you have to logof and login again
If you run it on the prompt, it will only affect that session
If you want it permanent, you need to put it in ~/.profile or ~/.pam_environment (in which case it will take effect next time you log in)
how to put it in profile? Just hardcoded in vi?
Yeah, you just add that line, export JAVA_... at the end of the file, and save
